docs.text:
MkDocs-Nature
§


A 
MkDocs
 Theme. A clone of the "greenish" 
Sphinx theme
 of the same name.


Documentation
§




Features


About


Contributing


Release Notes
docs.title: MkDocs-Nature

docs.text: A  MkDocs  Theme. A clone of the "greenish"  Sphinx theme  of the same name.
docs.title: MkDocs-Nature

docs.text: Features  About  Contributing  Release Notes
docs.title: Documentation

docs.text:
Features
§


The MkDocs-Nature theme supports a number of features which are configurable by
the end user.




Theme Variables


Search


Code Highlighting




Theme Variables
§


The theme includes support for a few variables which can be set by the user to
control the theme's behavior.


theme.icon
§


Point this setting at an image file in your 
docs_dir
 to display an icon in
your documentation.


theme
:

    
name
:
 
nature

    
icon
:
 
icon
.
png






theme.logo
§


Point this setting at an image file in your 
docs_dir
 to display logo in
your documentation.


theme
:

    
name
:
 
nature

    
logo
:
 
logo
.
png






theme.release
§


Use this setting to include the version of the project you are documenting in
your documentation.


theme
:

    
name
:
 
nature

    
release
:
 
2.1.3






theme.issue_tracker
§


Assign the URL for your issue tracker to this setting to include a "Report a
Bug" link on each page. For example, if you use GitHub to track issues:


theme
:

    
name
:
 
nature

    
issue_tracker
:
 
https
://
github
.
com
/user/project/iss
ues






repo_url
§


Assign the URL for your repository to this setting to include a link on each
page. See MkDocs' 
documentation
 for more details.


edit_uri
§


When set, an "edit this page" link is included on each page. Note that if the

repo_url
 points to either GitHub or Bitbucket, this setting is automatically
configured and does not need to be set manually. See MkDocs' 
documentation

for more details.


copyright
§


Assign the text to be used as a copyright notice in the footer of each page. For
example:


copyright
:
 
Copyright 
copy; 2017






site_author
§


Assign the name to be included with the copyright notice on each page. This
setting is ignored if 
copyright
 is not also set.


Search
§


The MkDocs-Nature theme includes support for MkDocs search plugin. As long as
the search plugin is enabled (MkDocs' default), a search page will be generated
and included in your site. If you would like to disable search, then disable the
search plugin by defining a 
plugins
 setting which does not include 
search
.
If you have no other plugins, then set 
plugins
 to an empty list:


plugins: []





Permalinks
§


To enable permalinks to appear when hovering over any page or section headers,
you need to enable the relevant configuration setting for the TOC extension of
Python-Markdown.


markdown_extensions:
    - toc:
        permalink: true





By default, the pilcrow or paragraph sign (
) is used for the permalink. If
you would like different text, set 
permalink
 to your desired string instead of

true
. For example setting it to 
§
 would display the section sign.


Admonitions
§


The appropriate CSS styles are defined to support the 
admonition
 extension to
Python-Markdown. To utilize admonitions, enable the extension in your config
file:


markdown_extensions:
    - admonition







Attention


See the Admonition Extension 
documentation
 for specifics on the syntax.




Code Highlighting
§


By enabling the 
codehilite
 extension in your 
mkdocs.yml
 config file you get
syntax highlighting support using Pygments' Tango theme.


Configuration
§


Enable the 
codehilite
 extension in your 
mkdocs.yml
 config file:


markdown_extensions
:

    
-
 
codehilite






Usage
§


For best results, be sure to identify the language of each code block in your
Markdown files.


JavaScript Sample
§


For example, by using the following Markdown:


```javascript
alert(
A JavaScript Alert!
);
```





Your codeblock will render as:


alert
(
A JavaScript Alert!
);






HTML Sample
§


!DOCTYPE html


html
 
lang
=
en

    
head

        
meta
 
http-equiv
=
Content-Type
 
content
=
text/html; charset=utf-8
 
/

        
title
Hello, World!
/
title

    
/
head

    
body

        
h1
Hello, World!
/
h1

    
/
body


/
html






Python Sample
§


 
def
 
hello
(
name
):


...
     
print
 
u
Hello, {}!
.
format
(
name
)


...


 
hello
(
World
)


u
Hello, World!

docs.title: Usage
JavaScript Sample

docs.text:
!DOCTYPE html  html   lang = en 
     head 
         meta   http-equiv = Content-Type   content = text/html; charset=utf-8   / 
         title Hello, World! / title 
     / head 
     body 
         h1 Hello, World! / h1 
     / body  / html

docs.text: def   hello ( name ):  ...       print   u Hello, {}! . format ( name )  ...    hello ( World )  u Hello, World!
docs.title: Python Sample

docs.text:
About MkDocs-Nature
§


Copyright
§


The original Sphinx theme ("nature") and its parts used here are copyright

 2007-2016 by the Sphinx team (see 
AUTHORS
).


The MkDocs templates, as well as additions and tweaks to the Sphinx theme are
copyright 
 2017 by Waylan Limberg.


License
§


The original Sphinx theme ("nature") and its parts used here are licensed under
a 
BSD License
.


The MkDocs templates, as well as additions and tweaks to the Sphinx theme are
licensed under a 
BSD License
.
docs.title: The Project

copyright   2017 by Waylan Limberg.

docs.title: License

docs.text:
Contributing to MkDocs-Nature
§


An introduction to contributing to the MkDocs-Nature Theme.


Contributions from developers and users are welcome. Contributions can be made
in a number of ways, including:




Code patches via pull requests


Documentation improvements


Bug reports and patch reviews




Resources
§


When contributing to the project, the following resources will likely be helpful
to you:




Source Code


Issue Tracker


MkDocs Documentation


Jinja Documentation


Source
 of parent 
Sphinx theme
.




Code of Conduct
§


Everyone interacting with the project's codebases, issue trackers, etc. is
expected to follow the 
PyPA Code of Conduct
.


Reporting an Issue
§


When reporting an issue, please include as much detail as you can, including
your platform, MkDocs version, theme version and relevent config settings. If
the problem is visual please include a screenshot and if you get an error please
include the full error and traceback.
docs.title: Contributing
